hints.content:
Let's look closely at the scatter plot shown.

Because the data shows a positive quadratic correlation, we can eliminate the choices that will have concave down graphs and describe decay:

 $\qquad y=-0.201x^2-0.264x+0.969$ 

and 

$\qquad y=-201.00x^2-264.00x+969.00$

That leaves the functions 

$\qquad y=201.00x^2-264.00x+969.00$ 

and 

$\qquad y=0.201x^2-0.264x+0.969$

whose graphs will both be concave up parabolas that describe growth.

The scatter plot point $(0,0)$ tells us that an appropriate function should have a $y$-intercept of approximately $0$.

- Because the $y$-intercept $(969.00)$ of the function $y=201.00x^2-264.00x+969.00$ is such a large value, its graph will not accurately describe the relationship shown in the scatter plot.

- Because the function $y=0.201x^2-0.264x+0.969$ has smaller coefficients and a $y$-intercept of $0.969$, it is the best choice to describe the relationship shown in the scatter plot.

Because the scatter plot shown depicts growth and has an initial point at the origin, the function that best describes it is:

$\qquad y=0.201x^2-0.264x+0.969$

$\qquad\qquad\text{U.S. annual per capita hfcs consumption in pounds,  } (y)$

![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/3cd230710797eb3aa5845353838e5d0f87897d67.png)
$\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad \text{Years since 1970, } (x)$

The function that best describes the relationship is:

$\qquad y=0.201x^2-0.264x+0.969$

question.content:
$\qquad\qquad\text{U.S. annual per capita hfcs consumption in pounds,  } (y)$

![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/111d461ec3d57f1a976f77c3e8a9ecb1f397b8d3.png)
$\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad \text{Years since 1970, } (x)$

The scatter plot drawn above depicts the average annual United States per capita consumption of high fructose corn syrup $(\text{hfcs})$ between the years $1970$ and $1985$. Which of the following functions best describes the relationship shown?

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.clue: This function would better fit a scatter plot with a negative quadratic correlation.
The coefficients and $y$-intercept values are too high to describe the relationship shown.
This function would better fit a scatter plot with a negative quadratic correlation.
